in_favor: Only half of primary schools and just 62% of secondary schools have basic infrastructure for students with disabilities.
The growth rate in schools' Internet access for pedagogical purposes doubled globally and even tripled in some regions.
Between 2021 and 2022, the proportion of primary school teachers with minimum required qualifications increased from 7 out of 10 to 9 out of 10 in most other regions.
against: A significant teacher qualification gap persists globally, with 15% of teachers lacking minimum qualifications.
Sub-Saharan Africa faces the steepest challenge, with only 60% of pre-primary teachers meeting standards compared to 90% in Europe and Northern America in 2022.
